Problem:
class TrafficSystem { constructor() { this.trafficLight = 'green'; this.carsMoving = true; } changeLight(color) { this.trafficLight = color; if (color === 'red') { this.carsMoving = false; } else { this.carsMoving = true; } } simulateAccident() { this.carsMoving = false; } getStatus() { return `Traffic Light: ${this.trafficLight}, Cars Moving: ${this.carsMoving}`; } } const cityTraffic = new TrafficSystem(); cityTraffic.changeLight('yellow'); cityTraffic.simulateAccident(); console.log(cityTraffic.getStatus());",

If an external agent sets the traffic light to green, will the cars start moving?
Explanation: When the traffic light is set to green via the changeLight method, the carsMoving property is set to true, which directly causes the cars to start moving again, assuming no other interventions like simulateAccident are active.
